dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so get this, right? May 14th, 2025. Like, Kazakhstan is just straight up banning the export of liquefied petroleum gas, propane, butane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so get this, right? May fourteenth, twenty twenty five. Like, Kazakhstan is just straight up banning the export of liquefied petroleum gas, propane, butane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting May 14, 2025, Kazakhstan will impose a temporary ban on the export of liquefied petroleum gas, propane, and butane.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, wait, May 2025? That's... uh... that's soon!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, wait, May twenty twenty five? That's... uh... that's soon!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! For six whole months! Road and rail, too. Like, completely cut off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! For six whole months! Road and rail, too. Like, completely cut off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The restriction will be in effect for six months and will apply to both road and rail transport.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Six months? That's a huge deal. And this is... it's because of a draft order, right? From the Minister of Energy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Six months? That's a huge deal. And this is... it's because of a draft order, right? From the Minister of Energy?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is stated in the explanatory note to the draft order of the Minister of Energy, published on the Open NPA portal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! It's in the explanatory note on the Open NPA portal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! It's in the explanatory note on the Open N P A portal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is stated in the explanatory note to the draft order of the Minister of Energy, published on the Open NPA portal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I remember hearing about shortages there, though. Wasn't it, like, October 2024?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I remember hearing about shortages there, though. Wasn't it, like, October twenty twenty four?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It™s worth recalling that in early October 2024, former Minister of Energy Almasadam Satkaliyev acknowledged that a shortage of liquefied gas had occurred at certain fuel stations in some regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, my god, yes! The former minister, Satkaliyev, admitted it then. He was like, "Yeah, some stations, some regions had issues."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, my god, yes! The former minister, Satkaliyev, admitted it then. He was like, Yeah, some stations, some regions had issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It™s worth recalling that in early October 2024, former Minister of Energy Almasadam Satkaliyev acknowledged that a shortage of liquefied gas had occurred at certain fuel stations in some regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But he blamed it on, like, harvesting and rain for grain drying, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he blamed it on, like, harvesting and rain for grain drying, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to him, the issue was due to the harvesting campaign and rains, which caused farmers to require additional resources for grain drying.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Farmers needed extra resources. But then he also said there was no general shortage of petroleum products in the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Farmers needed extra resources. But then he also said there was no general shortage of petroleum products in the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, he assured that there was no shortage of any type of petroleum product in the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then, get this, a year ago, he advised car owners not to convert their cars to autogas!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then, get this, a year ago, he advised car owners not to convert their cars to autogas!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nevertheless, a year ago, the minister had advised car owners not to convert their vehicles to run on autogas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's just... that's peak, isn't it? Like, "Don't use it, but there's no shortage!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's just... that's peak, isn't it? Like, Don't use it, but there's no shortage!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! He noted consumption just exceeded the planned volume in 2023.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! He noted consumption just exceeded the planned volume in twenty twenty three.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He noted that the consumption of liquefied petroleum gas had exceeded the planned volume in 2023.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they knew this was coming, then. Like, it's not a surprise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they knew this was coming, then. Like, it's not a surprise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, definitely not a surprise. This ban, it's just a response to a long-simmering issue, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, definitely not a surprise. This ban, it's just a response to a long-simmering issue, you know?

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. So, what happens to their neighbors when this hits?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. So, what happens to their neighbors when this hits?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's the big question, isn't it? We'll have to keep an eye on this.
